abstract.p: Howard Goldberg describes vineyard and winery and reviews several wines from Millbrook Vineyards and Winery in Millbrook, NY; photo (M)

block.p: For Westchester's wine lovers, Millbrook, a serene semirural community in Dutchess County, is both a destination for leisurely wine excursions and the brand name of a line of wines.
Since 1981, when the Millbrook Vineyards and Winery produced its first commercial vintage, it has been the Hudson Valley's outstanding winery and one of New York State's best.
For Westchester's wine lovers, Millbrook, a serene semirural community in Dutchess County, is both a destination for leisurely wine excursions and the brand name of a line of wines.
Since 1981, when the Millbrook Vineyards and Winery produced its first commercial vintage, it has been the Hudson Valley's outstanding winery and one of New York State's best.
All the whites and reds on the 130-acre estate are made from vinifera, the classic European wine grapes.

Millbrook is owned by John W. Dyson and his wife, Kathe. Although he is perhaps best known now as a vintner, politics has been a forte; for a time, he was Rudolph W. Giuliani's deputy mayor for economic development.

In 1979, as commissioner of the State Department of Commerce in Gov. Hugh L. Carey's administration, Mr. Dyson, a Democrat, coined the slogan ''I Love New York.'' Today, he also loves wine in California and Tuscany.
Millbrook's aromatic '98 Tocai Friulano, a sprightly light-bodied white based on an Italian grape and long a food-oriented feature of its portfolio, is found around Westchester for about $13.
The buttery-oaky, light-bodied simple '97 chardonnay, in a crisp Burgundian style that offers not an iota of California-type fatness, is about $15.
And the opulent, jammy, smooth-textured, almost-sweet, mouth-filling Proprietor's Special Reserve '98 cabernet franc, based on a grape that in Bordeaux is used primarily for blending, is about $19.
Open daily all year from noon to 5 p.m. for tastings and tours, the hillside winery occupies a spacious whitewashed Dutch hip-roofed dairy barn.
It commands inspiring rural vistas and is situated near the junction of the Shunpike and Wing Road in Millbrook.
